data.name: Origins of Debt
data.text: Governments accumulate national debt when they spend more money than they collect in taxes. This borrowing is often necessary to fund public services and infrastructure projects. However, excessive debt can lead to economic challenges, such as higher interest payments and potential inflation.

data.name: Dealing with National Debt
data.text: To manage national debt effectively, governments can use strategies such as fiscal discipline, controlling public spending, and implementing economic reforms. Additionally, they may consider refinancing debt at lower interest rates or issuing bonds to raise funds from investors.
